title: Vail, Colorado
summary: Vail is a home rule municipality in Eagle County, Colorado, United States. The population of the town was 4,835 in 2020.[7] The town, home to Vail Ski Resort, the largest ski mountain in Colorado, is known for its hotels, dining, and for the numerous events the city hosts annually, such as the Vail Film Festival, Burton US Open, Vail Resorts Snow Days, and Bravo! Vail.[8][9][10][11]
